conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, and C) based on the arrangement of the baffles.
Liquid starts from the top left position labeled A.
First baffle encountered is the white baffle, angled downward to the right.
Liquid will flow along the white baffle and be directed towards the right.
Next baffle encountered is the yellow baffle, angled downward to the left.
Liquid will flow along the yellow baffle and be directed towards the left.
Finally encounters the black baffle, angled downward to the right.
Liquid will flow along the black baffle and be directed towards the right.
Liquid will reach the bottom section and flow into container E.
Liquid starts from the middle position labeled B.
First baffle encountered is the yellow baffle, angled downward to the left.
Liquid will flow along the yellow baffle and be directed towards the left.
Next baffle encountered is the blue baffle, angled downward to the right.
Liquid will flow along the blue baffle and be directed towards the right.
Finally encounters the orange baffle, angled downward to the left.
Liquid will flow along the orange baffle and be directed towards the left.
Liquid will reach the bottom section and flow into container F.
Liquid starts from the top right position labeled C.
First baffle encountered is the blue baffle, angled downward to the right.
Liquid will flow along the blue baffle and be directed towards the right.
Next baffle encountered is the orange baffle, angled downward to the left.
Liquid will flow along the orange baffle and be directed towards the left.
Finally encounters the black baffle, angled downward to the right.
Liquid will flow along the black baffle and be directed towards the right.
